text:
We're hopping in here
to help you announce this...

car parade.
- This is a NASCAR race, guys.
[upbeat music]
- Hi, I'm Seth MacFarlane,

and welcome to the Peacock
"At-Home Variety Show,"

benefiting great organizations
like Americares,

Feeding America,
and United Way,

all of whom are working
very hard

to assist those in need
during this pandemic.

Well, tonight we have
two special guests.

You know them from
the "Pitch Perfect" franchise.

And, you know,
I gotta tell you,

if I had known that you could
make so much money

by mixing comedy
and cheesy singing,

I probably would actually have
the same career as I do now.
But, uh, anyway, here they are,

Elizabeth Banks
and John Michael Higgins.
[dramatic music]
- Welcome back to NBC Sports.
- Hi, I'm Dale Earnhardt Jr.

If you're just tuning in
with us,

we're taking a look back
at last year's race
at Homestead-Miami Speedway.

Reddick and Custer are up front
in the top two spots
as we head into lap 12.
both: Zoom-bomb!

- Wait, aren't you
those announcers
from the a-cappella contests?

- I think we have just seen
some a-cappella history
being made, John.

- And from an all-female
group, Gail.

I could never have
called this one.

- Never? Well, you are
a misogynist at heart,

so there's no way you would
have bet on these girls.
- Absolutely.
Yes, I'm John Smith.

- And I'm Gail
Abernathy-McKadden-Feinberger.

- I guess you could say
we're junkies for announcing,

in addition to several other
soft narcotics.

- And we need our fix,
so if you don't mind,

we're hopping in here
to help you announce this...

car parade.
- This is a NASCAR race, guys.

Ty Reddick, man,
he is perfectly comfortable

riding up
against that high line.
Look at him run that fence.

- Yeah, yeah,
we'll take it from here.

And here they come,
speeding around the turn!

- Whoo.
- Boy, this looks fun.

Makes me wish I hadn't had
my license revoked.

Is it my fault that damn
armadillo had a death wish?
- It was a dog, John.

- Dog looked like it was
wearing a coat of armor.

- So once these cars
get enough momentum,

they just start to fly, right?
They just take right off.

Because they're little
airplanes, isn't that true?

- No, not little airplanes.
Regular-sized cars.

- You know what else
could spice things up?
A pedestrian.

Just have somebody run across
the tracks, see what happens.

- How about a couple
of announcers?

- Now, Dale, I've seen
this sport played at carnivals.

When do the drivers start
ramming into each other?

- I think you're thinking
of bumper car.
- Bump her? I hardly know her!

- That's never
stopped you before, John.
- Oh!
The 15 car has lost his fender.

He has no control.
He's headed for a pit stop.

- Well, Dale, this is hardly
the time to pee.

You know, that's why I always
wear a diaper when I drive,
like that crazy astronaut lady

who drove all the way
across the country

in a diaper to attack
her ex's girlfriend.

- I wear a diaper sometimes
just to feel like a baby again.

- He's not going to pee.
He's going to the pit crew.

- Ooh, tell me more
about the pit crew.

How many men does it take
to fix a little bit of damage?

- Why don't you ask
your ex-husbands, Gail?
- Oh, there's so many.

- These pit crews
are lightning fast.

They're capable of finishing
in under 12 seconds.

- Wow, add 18 seconds to that
and that was my prom night.

- Then subtract five seconds
from that,
put it in a Denny's bathroom,
and that's my prom night.
- That's, uh, that's just sad.

I'm gonna do something I should
have done a long time ago.

- Bathroom--
[button clicks]
- God bless the mute button.
Now let's get back to the race.

- Hi, guys.
I'm Jax.

This is Brittany.
We're from "Vanderpump Rules."

- Hey, guys,
it's Ryan Tedder.

- Hey, what's going
on everybody?

This is Ne-Yo.
- This is Alan Tudyk.
- Hi, I'm Bob Harper.

- What's up?
It's the most "must-see"

WWE superstar
of all time, The Miz.
[energetic music]

- We've kind of gotten
creative with it.

We found some different ways
to work out.

- I mean, he's got a lot
of different ways.

Okay, guys, this is how
I get Jax to run sprints.
[quirky music]
[glasses clink, liquid pours]

Honey!
I just poured you a shot!
[electronic dance music]
- ♪ Uh, let's go ♪

- I've been doing a lot
of very strenuous exercise.
Especially a lot of curls.
One.
[video game zapping]

- Another option:
if you have small puppies
dumbbells.

[Brittany laughs]
[dog barks]
- Three.
[video game zapping]

[muffled] It don't count
if it don't burn.

- You can give them kisses
at the end.
[dog growling]

- Orlando Jones here
trying to get a...

windy quarantine workout
in Wilmington--
Whoa!
- This is good.
I'm getting extra swole
right in the midsection.

- Obviously I'm working out,
but what I really love to do
is work out my fiancé.

- Here's one of
the primary workouts
that I have been doing.
- And the best part is,
I just make him hold it.

- I gotta make sure everything
is in tip-top shape

while doing my Zoom meetings,
so what do I do?

I double task.
Uphill walks.

- So I'll kind of rotate
in between left and right
to kind of get them both.
- Pretty good workout actually.
[grunts] Ohh.
- And then you give me a kiss.
[laughs]
- [grunting] Four.
Almost spilled something.
- [grunts]
There you go.
- And then it's time for a nap.
[upbeat music]
